adjective.description: Of or denoting the sex that can bear offspring or produce eggs, distinguished biologically by the production of gametes (ova) which can be fertilized by male gametes.

noun.description: A female person, animal, or plant.

origin: Middle English: from Old French femelle, from Latin femella, diminutive of femina a woman. The change in the ending was due to association with male, but the words male and female are not linked etymologically.
